00084 /** 
00085  * \ingroup PrivateDataset
00086  * \brief The number of allocated slots in the dataset table.
00087  */
00088 static int dsTableSize = 0;
00089 /** 
00090  * \ingroup PrivateDataset
00091  * \brief The datasest table.
00092  */
00093 static _FC_DsSlot **dsTable = NULL;

00096  * \brief The list of unused slots in the dataset table.
00097  */

00100 /** \name Create new dataset from scratch. */
00101 //-------------------------------
00102 //@{
00103 
00104 
00105 /**
00106  * \ingroup  Dataset
00107  * \brief  Create a new dataset.
00108  *
00109  * \description
00110  *
00111  *    Create a new, in memory, dataset. 
00112  *
00113  * \modifications  
00114  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
00115  */
00116 FC_ReturnCode fc_createDataset(
00117   char *name,          /**< input - name for new dataset */
00118   FC_Dataset *dataset   /**< output - new dataset  */
00119 ) {
00120   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00121   
00122   // default return
00123   if (dataset != NULL)
00124     *dataset = FC_NULL_DATASET;
00125   
00126   // check input
00127   if (name == NULL || dataset == NULL) {
00128     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00129     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00130   }
00131 
00132   // make sure library is ready, return error if it's not
00133   if (!_fc_isLibraryInit()) {
00134     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot create a dataset until library is initialized.");
00135     return FC_ERROR;
00136   }
00137     
00138   // log message
00139   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating new dataset '%s'", name);
00140 
00141   // get an open slot
00142   dsSlot = _fc_getNewDsSlot();
00143   if (dsSlot == NULL) {
00144     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00145     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00146   }
00147   
00148   // table header information
00149   _FC_GET_HANDLE(*dataset, dsSlot);
00150   _fc_setSlotHeaderName(&(dsSlot->header), name);
00151   
00152   return FC_SUCCESS;
00153 }
00154 
00155 /** \name Other ways to get new datasets. */
00156 //-------------------------------
00157 //@{
00158 
00159 /**
00160  * \ingroup  Dataset
00161  * \brief  Copy a dataset
00162  *
00163  * \description
00164  *  
00165  *    Create a copy of a dataset with the given name. This routine will
00166  *    copy all subentities (sequences & meshes).
00167  *
00168  * \modifications 
00169  *   - 2003-NOV-11 WSK Created
00170  *   - 9/21/2006 WSD Added copying of global vars.
00171  */
00172 FC_ReturnCode fc_copyDataset(
00173   FC_Dataset src_ds,  /**< Input - the source dataset to be copied */
00174   char *newName,      /**< Input - the name of the new dataset, a NULL value
00175                  is a flag to use the name of the source dataset */
00176   FC_Dataset* new_ds  /**< Output - handle to the new dataset */
00177 ) { 
00178   int i, j;
00179   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00180   _FC_DsSlot* src_dsSlot;
00181 
00182   // default return
00183   if (new_ds)
00184     *new_ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
00185 
00186   // check input
00187   src_dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(src_ds);
00188   if (src_dsSlot == NULL || new_ds == NULL) {
00189     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00190     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00191   }
00192 
00193   // test for NULL name
00194   if (newName == NULL)
00195     newName = src_dsSlot->header.name;
00196 
00197   // log message
00198   fc_printfLogMessage("Copying dataset '%s' to '%s'", src_dsSlot->header.name,
00199                       newName);
00200 
00201   // create new dataset with new name
00202   rc = fc_createDataset(newName, new_ds);
00203   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00204     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to create new dataset '%s'",
00205                           newName);
00206     return FC_ERROR;
00207   }
00208 
00209   // copy the sequences
00210   for (i = 0; i < src_dsSlot->numSeq; i++) {
00211     FC_Sequence src_seq, new_seq;
00212     _FC_SeqSlot* src_seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(src_dsSlot->seqIDs[i]);
00213     _FC_GET_HANDLE(src_seq, src_seqSlot);
00214     rc = fc_copySequence(src_seq, *new_ds, NULL, &new_seq);
00215     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00216       fc_deleteDataset(*new_ds);
00217       *new_ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
00218       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to copy sequence '%s'",
00219                             src_seqSlot->header.name);
00220       return rc;
00221     }
00222   }
00223 
00224   // copy the global vars
00225   for (i = 0; i < src_dsSlot->numBasicVar; i++) {
00226     FC_Variable src_var, new_var;
00227     _FC_VarSlot* src_varSlot = _fc_getVarSlotFromID(src_dsSlot->basicVarIDs[i]);
00228     _FC_GET_HANDLE(src_var, src_varSlot);
00229     rc = fc_copyGlobalVariable(src_var, *new_ds, NULL, &new_var);
00230     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00231       fc_deleteDataset(*new_ds);
00232       *new_ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
00233       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to copy global var '%s'",
00234                    src_varSlot->header.name);
00235       return rc;
00236     }
00237   }
00238   
00239   // copy the global seq vars
00240   // (similar to code in fc_copyMesh())
00241   for (i = 0; i < src_dsSlot->numSeqVar; i++) {
00242     int numStep = src_dsSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[i];
00243     FC_Variable src_seqVar[numStep], *new_seqVar;
00244     int temp_numSeq;
00245     FC_Sequence dest_seq, *temp_seqs;
00246     _FC_VarSlot* src_varSlot = _fc_getVarSlotFromID(src_dsSlot->seqVarIDs[i][0]);
00247     _FC_SeqSlot* src_seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(src_varSlot->sequence);
00248 
00249     // find the appropriate new sequence from the dest sequences
00250     rc = fc_getSequences(*new_ds, &temp_numSeq, &temp_seqs);
00251     for (j = 0; j < temp_numSeq; j++) {
00252       char* temp_name;
00253       int temp_numStep;
00254       FC_DataType temp_dataType;
00255       void* temp_coords;
00256       rc = fc_getSequenceName(temp_seqs[j], &temp_name);
00257       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00258           return rc;
00259       rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(temp_seqs[j], &temp_numStep, &temp_dataType);
00260       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00261      return rc;
00262       rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(temp_seqs[j], &temp_coords);
00263       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00264           return rc;
00265       if (!strcmp(temp_name, src_seqSlot->header.name) &&
00266        temp_numStep == src_seqSlot->numStep &&
00267        temp_dataType == src_seqSlot->datatype &&
00268        !memcmp(temp_coords, src_seqSlot->coords, src_seqSlot->numStep * 
00269             fc_sizeofDataType(src_seqSlot->datatype))) {
00270        free(temp_name);
00271        dest_seq = temp_seqs[j];
00272        break;
00273       }
00274       free(temp_name);
00275     }
00276     free(temp_seqs);
00277 
00278     // assemble handles
00279     for (j = 0; j < numStep; j++) {
00280       src_varSlot = _fc_getVarSlotFromID(src_dsSlot->seqVarIDs[i][j]);
00281       _FC_GET_HANDLE(src_seqVar[j], src_varSlot);
00282     }
00283 
00284 
00285     rc = fc_copyGlobalSeqVariable(numStep, src_seqVar, *new_ds, dest_seq,
00286                       NULL, &new_seqVar);
00287     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00288       fc_deleteDataset(*new_ds);
00289         *new_ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
00290       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to copy global var '%s'",
00291                    src_varSlot->header.name);
00292       return rc;
00293     }
00294     free(new_seqVar);
00295   }
00296 
00297   // copy the meshes
00298   for (i = 0; i < src_dsSlot->numMesh; i++) {
00299     FC_Mesh src_mesh, new_mesh;
00300     _FC_MeshSlot* src_meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlotFromID(src_dsSlot->meshIDs[i]);
00301     _FC_GET_HANDLE(src_mesh, src_meshSlot);
00302     rc = fc_copyMesh(src_mesh, *new_ds, NULL, &new_mesh);
00303     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00304       fc_deleteDataset(*new_ds);
00305       *new_ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
00306       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to copy mesh '%s'",
00307                             src_meshSlot->header.name);
00308       return rc;
00309     }
00310   }
00311 
00312   return FC_SUCCESS;
00313 }
00314 
00315 //@}
00316 
00317 /** \name Get existing datasets. */
00318 //-------------------------------
00319 //@{
00320 
00321 /**
00322  * \ingroup  Dataset
00323  * \brief  Return a list of datasets in the library.
00324  *
00325  * \description
00326  *  
00327  *    Returns an array of handles for the existing datasets. The user is 
00328  *    responsible for freeing the array of handles.
00329  *
00330  * \modifications  
00331  *   - 9/8/04 WSK Created.
00332  */
00333 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDatasets(
00334  int *numDataset,       /**< output - number of existing datasets */
00335  FC_Dataset **datasets  /**< output - array of dataset (optional) */
00336 ) {
00337   int i;
00338   int num;
00339   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00340   
00341   // default return values
00342   if (numDataset != NULL) 
00343     *numDataset = -1;
00344   if (datasets != NULL)
00345     *datasets = NULL;  
00346   
00347   // call on uninitialized library is an error
00348   if (!_fc_isLibraryInit()) {
00349     fc_printfErrorMessage("Library has not been initialized");
00350     return FC_ERROR;
00351   }
00352 
00353   // check input
00354   if (numDataset == NULL || datasets == NULL) {
00355     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00356     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00357   }
00358   
00359   // log message
00360   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting datasets");
00361   
00362   // count datasets
00363   num = 0;
00364   for (i = 0; i < _fc_getDsTableSize(); i++) {
00365     dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlotFromID(i);
00366     if (dsSlot) 
00367       num++;
00368   }
00369   *numDataset = num;
00370 
00371   // get handles
00372   if (num > 0) {
00373     *datasets = (FC_Dataset*)malloc(num*sizeof(FC_Dataset));
00374     if (*datasets == NULL) {
00375       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00376       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00377     }
00378     num = 0;
00379     for (i = 0; i < _fc_getDsTableSize(); i++) {
00380       dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlotFromID(i);
00381       if (dsSlot) {
00382         _FC_GET_HANDLE((*datasets)[num], dsSlot);
00383         num++;
00384       }
00385     }
00386   }
00387   
00388   return FC_SUCCESS;
00389 }
00390 
00391 /**
00392  * \ingroup  Dataset
00393  * \brief  Return number of datasets in the library.
00394  *
00395  * \modifications  
00396  *   - 9/28/04 WSK Created.
00397  */
00398 FC_ReturnCode fc_getNumDataset(
00399  int *numDataset      /**< output - number of existing datasets */
00400 ) {
00401   int i, num;
00402   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00403   
00404   // default return values
00405   if (numDataset != NULL) 
00406     *numDataset = -1;
00407   
00408   // call on uninitialized library is an error
00409   if (!_fc_isLibraryInit()) {
00410     fc_printfErrorMessage("Library has not been initialized");
00411     return FC_ERROR;
00412   }
00413 
00414   // check input
00415   if (numDataset == NULL) {
00416     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00417     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00418   }
00419   
00420   // log message
00421   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number of datasets");
00422   
00423   // count datasets
00424   num = 0;
00425   for (i = 0; i < _fc_getDsTableSize(); i++) {
00426     dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlotFromID(i);
00427     if (dsSlot) 
00428       num++;
00429   }
00430   *numDataset = num;
00431   
00432   return FC_SUCCESS;
00433 }
00434 
00435 /**
00436  * \ingroup  Dataset
00437  * \brief  Gets all datasets with a given name
00438  *
00439  * \description
00440  *
00441  *    Return the handles of all datasets with the given name.  
00442  *
00443  * \modifications  
00444  *   - 9/8/04 WSK, created.
00445  *   - 9/21/06 ACG now returns multiple matching items.
00446  */
00447 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDatasetByName(
00448   char *datasetName,    /**< input - name of dataset to find */
00449   int *numDatasets,     /**< output - num matching datasets */
00450   FC_Dataset **datasets   /**< output - dataset handle */
00451 ) {
00452   int i;
00453   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00454   FC_Dataset dataset;
00455   FC_Dataset *lmatch = NULL;
00456   int numlmatch, maxnumlmatch;
00457   
00458   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
00459   if (numDatasets)
00460     *numDatasets = -1;
00461   if (datasets)
00462     *datasets = NULL;
00463   
00464   // call on uninitialized library is an error
00465   if (!_fc_isLibraryInit()) {
00466     fc_printfErrorMessage("Library has not been initialized");
00467     return FC_ERROR;
00468   }
00469 
00470   // check input
00471   if (datasetName == NULL || !datasets || !numDatasets) {
00472     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00473     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00474   }
00475 
00476   // log message
00477   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting dataset '%s'", datasetName);
00478 
00479   numlmatch = 0;
00480   maxnumlmatch = 0;
00481   
00482   // look for existing slot with the matching name
00483   for (i = 0; i < _fc_getDsTableSize(); i++) {
00484     dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlotFromID(i);
00485     if (dsSlot) {
00486       if (!strcmp(datasetName, dsSlot->header.name)) {
00487         _FC_GET_HANDLE(dataset, dsSlot);
00488 
00489      if (lmatch == NULL){
00490        lmatch = (FC_Dataset*)malloc(sizeof(FC_Dataset));
00491        if (lmatch == NULL){
00492          fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", 
00493                       fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00494          return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00495        }
00496        numlmatch = 1;
00497        maxnumlmatch = 1;
00498        lmatch[0] = dataset;
00499      }else{
00500        if(numlmatch == maxnumlmatch){
00501          FC_Dataset *temp;
00502          temp = (FC_Dataset*)realloc(lmatch,
00503                          (2*numlmatch)*sizeof(FC_Dataset));
00504          if (temp == NULL){
00505            fc_printfErrorMessage("%s",
00506                         fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00507            return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00508          }
00509          maxnumlmatch*=2;
00510          lmatch = temp;
00511        }
00512        lmatch[numlmatch] = dataset;
00513        numlmatch++;
00514      }
00515       }
00516     }
00517   }
00518 
00519   *numDatasets = numlmatch;
00520   *datasets = lmatch;
00521 
00522   return FC_SUCCESS;
00523 }
00524 
00525 //@}
00526 
00527 /** \name Change the name of a dataset. */
00528 //-------------------------------
00529 //@{
00530 
00531 /**
00532  * \ingroup Dataset
00533  * \brief  Change the name of a dataset.
00534  *
00535  * \description
00536  *
00537  *    This does not affect the name of the file the dataset is associated with.
00538  *
00539  * \modifications
00540  *   - 8/24/2005 WSD. Created.
00541  */
00542 FC_ReturnCode fc_changeDatasetName(
00543   FC_Dataset dataset, /**< Input - the dataset. */
00544   char* newName       /**< Input - new name for the dataset. */
00545 ) {
00546   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00547 
00548   // check input
00549   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
00550   if (dsSlot == NULL || newName == NULL) {
00551     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00552     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00553   }
00554 
00555   // log message
00556   fc_printfLogMessage("Changing name of dataset from '%s' to '%s'", 
00557                       dsSlot->header.name, newName);
00558   
00559   // Do it
00560   return _fc_setSlotHeaderName(&dsSlot->header, newName);
00561 }
00562 
00563 //@}
00564 
00565 /** \name Release/delete datasets. */
00566 //-------------------------------
00567 //@{
00568 
00569 /**
00570  * \ingroup Dataset
00571  * \brief Attempt to minimize dataset's memory usage.
00572  *
00573  * \description
00574  *
00575  *    Call to try to release un-needed memory in a dataset. It the dataset has
00576  *    been saved to disk, the large data is released. If the dataset has not be
00577  *    saved to disk, all large data is saved.
00578  *
00579  *    This function will recursively call release on it's child sequences and
00580  *    meshes (and they will call their children).
00581  *
00582  * \modifications
00583  *    - 9/27/04 WSK Created.
00584  */
00585 FC_ReturnCode fc_releaseDataset(
00586  FC_Dataset dataset       /**< input - dataset handle */
00587 ) {
00588   int i;
00589   FC_Sequence *sequences;
00590   FC_Mesh *meshes;
00591   FC_Variable *variables, **seqVariables;
00592   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00593   int numSequence, numMesh, numVar, numSeqVar, *numSteps;
00594   
00595   // special case: releasing a null handle is not an error
00596   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(dataset, FC_NULL_DATASET)) {
00597     fc_printfWarningMessage("Releasing FC_NULL_DATASET");
00598     return FC_SUCCESS;
00599   }
00600 
00601   // check input
00602   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
00603   if (dsSlot == NULL) {
00604     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00605     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00606   }
00607   
00608   // log message
00609   fc_printfLogMessage("Cleaning up dataset '%s'", dsSlot->header.name);
00610 
00611   // call release on children sequences & meshes & global vars
00612   fc_getSequences(dataset, &numSequence, &sequences);
00613   for (i = 0; i < numSequence; i++) 
00614     fc_releaseSequence(sequences[i]); 
00615   free(sequences);
00616   fc_getMeshes(dataset, &numMesh, &meshes);
00617   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) 
00618     fc_releaseMesh(meshes[i]);
00619   free(meshes);
00620   fc_getGlobalVariables(dataset, &numVar, &variables);
00621   for (i = 0; i < numVar; i++)
00622     fc_releaseVariable(variables[i]);
00623   free(variables);
00624   fc_getGlobalSeqVariables(dataset, &numSeqVar, &numSteps, &seqVariables);
00625   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++)
00626     fc_releaseSeqVariable(numSteps[i], seqVariables[i]);
00627   free(numSteps);
00628   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++)
00629     free(seqVariables[i]);
00630   free(seqVariables);
00631   
00632   // no big data
00633   //if (dsSlot->header.committed == 1) {
00634   //}
00635 
00636   return FC_SUCCESS;
00637 }
00638 
00639 /**
00640  * \ingroup  Dataset
00641  * \brief  Delete a dataset.
00642  *
00643  * \description
00644  *  
00645  *    Call when this dataset is no longer needed.  It deletes
00646  *    the dataset and all of it's children including
00647  *    it's meshes, variables, etc.
00648  *
00649  * \modifications  
00650  *   - Nancy Collins  Created.
00651  *   - Aug 5, 2002  W Koegler  Now calls _fc_killDsSlot so that 
00652  *     fc_closeDataset and fc_openDataset can use the same code to 
00653  *     release the dsTable slot.
00654  *   - 11/20/03 RM, added more input checking, if dataset closed with default 
00655  *     handle \ref FC_NULL_DATASET then do nothing and return success (issue 
00656  *     warning if fc_getLibraryVerbosity()).
00657  *   - 9/21/2006 WSD added deleting of member global vars
00658  */
00659 FC_ReturnCode fc_deleteDataset(
00660  FC_Dataset dataset  /**< input - dataset to be deleted */
00661 ) {
00662   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00663   int i;
00664   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00665   int numSequence, numMesh, numVar, numSeqVar, *numStepPerVar;
00666   FC_Sequence *sequences;
00667   FC_Mesh *meshes;
00668   FC_Variable *variables, **seqVariables;
00669   
00670   // special case: deleting a null handle is not an error
00671   if ( FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(dataset, FC_NULL_DATASET)) {
00672     fc_printfWarningMessage("Deleting FC_NULL_DATASET.");
00673     return FC_SUCCESS;
00674   }
00675   
00676   // check input
00677   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
00678   if (dsSlot == NULL) {
00679     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00680     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00681   }
00682   
00683   // log message
00684   fc_printfLogMessage("Deleting dataset '%s'", dsSlot->header.name);
00685 
00686   // free up any file IO related stuff
00687   if (dsSlot->header.committed) {
00688     rc = _fc_closeDataset(dataset);
00689     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00690       return rc;
00691   }
00692 
00693   // delete member global vars
00694   rc = fc_getGlobalVariables(dataset, &numVar, &variables);
00695   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00696     return rc;
00697   for (i = 0; i < numVar; i++) {
00698     rc = fc_deleteVariable(variables[i]);
00699     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00700       return rc;
00701   }
00702   free(variables);
00703 
00704   // delete member global seq vars
00705   rc = fc_getGlobalSeqVariables(dataset, &numSeqVar, &numStepPerVar, 
00706                     &seqVariables);
00707   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00708     return rc;
00709   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++) {
00710     rc = fc_deleteSeqVariable(numStepPerVar[i], seqVariables[i]);
00711     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00712       return rc;
00713   }
00714   free(numStepPerVar);
00715   for (i = 0; i < numSeqVar; i++)
00716     free(seqVariables[i]);
00717   free(seqVariables);
00718   
00719   // delete member meshes
00720   rc = fc_getMeshes(dataset, &numMesh, &meshes);
00721   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00722     return rc;
00723   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
00724     rc = fc_deleteMesh(meshes[i]);
00725     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00726       return rc;
00727   }
00728   free(meshes);
00729 
00730   // delete member sequences
00731   rc = fc_getSequences(dataset, &numSequence, &sequences);
00732   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00733     return rc;
00734   for (i = 0; i < numSequence; i++) {
00735     rc = fc_deleteSequence(sequences[i]);
00736     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00737       return rc;
00738   }
00739   free(sequences);
00740   
00741   // clear & delete slot
00742   return _fc_deleteDsSlot(dataset);
00743 }
00744 
00745 //@}
00746 
00747 /** \name Get dataset metadata. */
00748 //-------------------------------
00749 //@{
00750 
00751 /**
00752  * \ingroup  Dataset
00753  * \brief Check that the handle refers to a valid dataset.
00754  *
00755  * \description
00756  *
00757  *    Returns 1 (true) if the handle is valid, and 0 (false) if it is not.
00758  *
00759  * \modifications  
00760  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Created.
00761  */
00762 int fc_isDatasetValid(
00763   FC_Dataset dataset  /**< input - dataset handle */
00764 ) {
00765   return _fc_isHandleValid(dataset.slotID, dataset.uID, dsTableSize,
00766                            (_FC_SlotHeader**)dsTable);
00767 }
00768 
00769 /**
00770  * \ingroup  Dataset
00771  * \brief Return name of a dataset
00772  *
00773  * \description
00774  *  
00775  *    Return the name associated with a dataset handle. Spaced
00776  *    is allocated for the string so it needs to be freed by the
00777  *    user when finished.
00778  *
00779  * \modifications  
00780  *    - Aug, 9, 2002.  W Koegler  Created.
00781  *    - 11/21/03 RM, added checking for NULL dataset handle
00782  *        default return filename as NULL if anything is wrong
00783  */
00784 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDatasetName(
00785   FC_Dataset dataset,  /**< input - dataset handle */
00786   char **dsName        /**< output - dataset name, space allocated here
00787                              and must be freed by user when finished */
00788 ) {
00789   char *cp;
00790   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00791   
00792   // default return value
00793   if (dsName)
00794     *dsName = NULL;
00795   
00796   // check input
00797   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
00798   if (dsSlot == NULL || dsName == NULL) {
00799     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00800     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00801   }
00802   
00803   // log message
00804   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting name for dataset '%s'", dsSlot->header.name);
00805 
00806   // copy name
00807   cp = dsSlot->header.name;
00808   *dsName = malloc(strlen(cp) + 1);
00809   if (*dsName == NULL) {
00810     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00811     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00812   }
00813   strcpy(*dsName, cp);
00814   
00815   return FC_SUCCESS;
00816 }
00817 
00818 //@}
00819 
00820 /** \name Print dataset. */
00821 //-------------------------------
00822 //@{
00823 
00824 /**
00825  * \ingroup  Dataset
00826  * \brief Print dataset meta data to stdout.
00827  *
00828  * \modifications 
00829  *    - 11/20/03 WSK Created.
00830  */
00831 FC_ReturnCode fc_printDataset(
00832   FC_Dataset dataset,   /**< input - dataset */
00833   char* label           /**< input - label to prepend dataset name with, 
00834                                      can be NULL */
00835 ) {
00836   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00837   int numMesh, numSeq;
00838   int numGlbVar, numGlbSeqVar;
00839   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00840 
00841   // special case: printing a null handle is not an error
00842   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(dataset, FC_NULL_DATASET)) {
00843     printf("Dataset: FC_NULL_DATASET\n");
00844     fflush(NULL);
00845     return FC_SUCCESS;
00846   }
00847 
00848   // check input
00849   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
00850   if (dsSlot == NULL) {
00851     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00852     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00853   }
00854 
00855   // log message
00856   fc_printfLogMessage("Printing dataset '%s'", dsSlot->header.name);
00857 
00858   // print label & var name
00859   if (label)
00860     printf("%s: ", label);
00861   else
00862     printf("Dataset: ");
00863   printf("'%s'\n", dsSlot->header.name);
00864   fflush(NULL);
00865 
00866   // print meta data
00867   rc = fc_getNumSequence(dataset, &numSeq);
00868   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00869     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get sequences for dataset '%s'",
00870                           dsSlot->header.name);
00871     return rc;
00872   }
00873   rc = fc_getNumGlobalVariable(dataset, &numGlbVar);
00874   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00875     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get global vars for dataset '%s'",
00876                           dsSlot->header.name);
00877     return rc;
00878   }
00879   rc = fc_getNumGlobalSeqVariable(dataset, &numGlbSeqVar);
00880   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00881     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get global seq vars for dataset '%s'",
00882                           dsSlot->header.name);
00883     return rc;
00884   }
00885   rc = fc_getNumMesh(dataset, &numMesh);
00886   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00887     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get meshes for dataset '%s'",
00888                           dsSlot->header.name);
00889     return rc;
00890   }
00891   printf("%snumSeq = %d, numGlbVar = %d, numGlbSeqVar = %d, numMesh = %d\n",
00892          INDENT_STR, numSeq, numGlbVar, numGlbSeqVar, numMesh);
00893   fflush(NULL);
00894 
00895   return FC_SUCCESS;
00896 }
00897 
00898 //@}
00899 
00900 /**
00901  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
00902  * \brief  Initialize a dataset slot
00903  *
00904  * \modifications  
00905  *   APR-30-2003  W Koegler  Created. 
00906  */
00907 void _fc_initDsSlot(
00908   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot    /**< input - the dataset slot to initialize */
00909 ) {
00910   if (dsSlot != NULL) {
00911     _fc_initSlotHeader(&dsSlot->header);
00912     dsSlot->fileType = FC_FT_NONE;
00913     dsSlot->baseFile = NULL;
00914     dsSlot->writable = 1;
00915     dsSlot->numSeq = 0;
00916     dsSlot->seqIDs = NULL;
00917     dsSlot->numMesh = 0;
00918     dsSlot->meshIDs = NULL;
00919     dsSlot->numBasicVar = 0;
00920     dsSlot->basicVarIDs = NULL;
00921     dsSlot->numSeqVar = 0;
00922     dsSlot->numStepPerSeqVar = 0;
00923     dsSlot->seqVarIDs = 0;
00924   }   
00925 }
00926 
00927 /**
00928  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
00929  * \brief  Clear a dataset slot
00930  *
00931  * \description
00932  * 
00933  *    Releases all dynamically allocated resources in a dataset,
00934  *    and reinitializes all members.
00935  *
00936  * \modifications  
00937  *   - 2003-APR-17  W Koegler  Created
00938  *   - 2003-APR-31  W Koegler  Made more comprehensive
00939  */
00940 void _fc_clearDsSlot(
00941  _FC_DsSlot* dsSlotp       /**< input - dtable pointer */
00942 ) {
00943   int i;
00944 
00945   if (dsSlotp != NULL) {
00946     // free strings
00947     if (dsSlotp->baseFile)
00948       free(dsSlotp->baseFile);
00949 
00950     // free dynamic arrays
00951     if (dsSlotp->meshIDs)
00952       free(dsSlotp->meshIDs);
00953     if (dsSlotp->seqIDs)
00954       free(dsSlotp->seqIDs);
00955     if (dsSlotp->basicVarIDs)
00956       free(dsSlotp->basicVarIDs);
00957     if (dsSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar)
00958       free(dsSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar);
00959     if (dsSlotp->seqVarIDs) {
00960       for (i = 0; i < dsSlotp->numSeqVar; i++)
00961      free(dsSlotp->seqVarIDs[i]);
00962       free(dsSlotp->seqVarIDs);
00963     }
00964 
00965     // clear table header
00966     _fc_clearSlotHeader(&dsSlotp->header);
00967 
00968     // reinit
00969     _fc_initDsSlot(dsSlotp);
00970   }
00971 }
00972 
00973 /**
00974  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
00975  * \brief  Get the size of the dataset table.
00976  *
00977  * \modifications  
00978  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
00979  */
00980 int _fc_getDsTableSize() {
00981   return dsTableSize;
00982 }
00983 
00984 /**
00985  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
00986  * \brief   Get an empty dataset slot from the dataset table.
00987  *
00988  * \description
00989  *  
00990  *    Will return a new slot or NULL. A NULL means a memory error occurred.
00991  *
00992  * \modifications  
00993  *    - 2003-MAY-01  W Koegler  Created
00994  *    - 12/08/03 WSK Changed because changed XTables from arrays of slots
00995  *      to arrays of handles to slots. The _fc_new_XSlot() routines do
00996  *      not call a common helper routine anymore.
00997  *    - 5/11/04 WSK  Moved common code from _fc_getNewDsSlot(), 
00998  *      _fc_getNewSeqSlot(), etc to _fc_getNewSlot().
00999  */
01000 _FC_DsSlot* _fc_getNewDsSlot() {
01001   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01002 
01003   dsSlot = (_FC_DsSlot*) _fc_getNewSlot(&dsTableSize, 
01004                          (_FC_SlotHeader***)&dsTable, 
01005                          &dsOpenSlots, sizeof(_FC_DsSlot));
01006   _fc_initDsSlot(dsSlot);
01007 
01008   return dsSlot;
01009 }
01010 
01011 /**
01012  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
01013  * \brief Get a dataset slot from a dataset handle.
01014  *
01015  * \description
01016  * 
01017  *    The slot id of the dataset handle is used to find the
01018  *    the slot in the dataset table. The identity is then
01019  *    verified by checking that the slot and the handle's
01020  *    uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot 
01021  *    is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.
01022  *
01023  * \modifications
01024  *   - 2003-OCT-19  WSK  Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID 
01025  *       for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug
01026  *       prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
01027  *   - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
01028  */
01029 _FC_DsSlot* _fc_getDsSlot(
01030   FC_Dataset dataset    /**< input - dataset */
01031 ) {
01032   if (_fc_isHandleValid(dataset.slotID, dataset.uID, dsTableSize,
01033                         (_FC_SlotHeader**)dsTable))
01034     return dsTable[dataset.slotID];
01035   else
01036     return NULL;
01037 }
01038 
01039 /**
01040  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
01041  * \brief Get a dataset slot based on ID.
01042  *
01043  * \description
01044  * 
01045  *    The _FC_DsSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should
01046  *    only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want
01047  *    because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getDsSlot.
01048  *    The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and
01049  *    that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).
01050  *
01051  * \modifications 
01052  *    - 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into
01053  *      tables without knowing about them.
01054  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.
01055  */
01056 _FC_DsSlot* _fc_getDsSlotFromID(
01057   int dsID
01058 ) {
01059   return (_FC_DsSlot*) _fc_getSlot(dsID, dsTableSize, 
01060                                    (_FC_SlotHeader**)dsTable);
01061 }
01062 
01063 /**
01064  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
01065  * \brief Delete the dataset slot associated with the dataset handle.
01066  *
01067  * \description 
01068  *    
01069  *    This routine clears the dynamic data in the slot and then
01070  *    deletes the slot from the table.
01071  *
01072  * \modifications
01073  *   - 12/20/2005 WSD. Created.
01074  */
01075 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteDsSlot(
01076   FC_Dataset dataset    /**< input - dataset */
01077 ) {
01078   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01079   
01080   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
01081   if (dsSlot == NULL) {
01082     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01083     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01084   }
01085 
01086   // do it
01087   _fc_clearDsSlot(dsSlot);
01088   return _fc_deleteSlot(dsSlot->header.slotID, dsTableSize, 
01089                (_FC_SlotHeader**)dsTable, &dsOpenSlots);
01090 }
01091 
01092 /**
01093  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
01094  * \brief  Print the contents of the Dataset Table (\ref dsTable) to stderr.
01095  *
01096  * \description
01097  *
01098  *    Prints the contents of the Datatset Table in a human readable form.
01099  *    It takes a string to use as a label for this print out of the table.
01100  *    Pass NULL if you don't want a label.
01101  *
01102  * \modifications 
01103  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
01104  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Fixed up.
01105  */
01106 void _fc_printDsTable(
01107   char *label /**< Input - label for this version the table (without a
01108                            trailing \\n) pass NULL if no label is desired */
01109 ) {
01110   int i, j, k;
01111   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01112 
01113   // print table heading
01114   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
01115   fprintf(stderr, "Dataset Table (dsTable):\n");
01116   if (label != NULL)
01117     fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", label);
01118   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
01119   fflush(NULL);
01120   
01121   // We're done if it's empty
01122   if (dsTableSize < 1) {
01123     fprintf(stderr, "(empty)\n");
01124     fprintf(stderr, "\n");
01125     fflush(NULL);
01126     return;
01127   }
01128 
01129   // print contents for each slot 
01130   for (i = 0; i < dsTableSize; i++) {
01131     dsSlot = dsTable[i];
01132     fprintf(stderr, "%3d: %s\n", i, (dsSlot) ? "exists" : "NULL");
01133     if (dsSlot == NULL)
01134       continue;
01135     _fc_printSlotHeader(dsSlot->header);
01136     fprintf(stderr, "     fileType = %s\n", 
01137             fc_getFileIOTypeText(dsSlot->fileType));
01138     fprintf(stderr, "     baseFile = %s\n", (dsSlot->baseFile) ?
01139             dsSlot->baseFile : "NULL");
01140     fprintf(stderr, "     writable = %d\n", dsSlot->writable);
01141     fprintf(stderr, "     numSeq = %d, seqIDs = ", dsSlot->numSeq);
01142     if (dsSlot->numSeq == 0) 
01143       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
01144     else {
01145       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", dsSlot->seqIDs[0]);
01146       for (j = 1; j < dsSlot->numSeq; j++)
01147         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", dsSlot->seqIDs[j]);
01148       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
01149     }
01150     fprintf(stderr, "     numMesh = %d, meshIDs = ", dsSlot->numMesh);
01151     if (dsSlot->numMesh == 0) 
01152       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
01153     else {
01154       fprintf(stderr, " { %d", dsSlot->meshIDs[0]);
01155       for (j = 1; j < dsSlot->numMesh; j++)
01156         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", dsSlot->meshIDs[j]);
01157       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
01158     }
01159     fprintf(stderr, "     numBasicVar = %d, basicVarIDs = ",
01160          dsSlot->numBasicVar);
01161     if (dsSlot->numBasicVar == 0) 
01162       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
01163     else {
01164       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", dsSlot->basicVarIDs[0]);
01165       for (j = 1; j < dsSlot->numBasicVar; j++)
01166         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", dsSlot->basicVarIDs[j]);
01167       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
01168     }
01169     fprintf(stderr, "     numSeqVar = %d, numStepPerSeqVar = ", dsSlot->numSeqVar);
01170     if (!dsSlot->numStepPerSeqVar)
01171       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
01172     else {
01173       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", dsSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[0]);
01174       for (j = 1; j < dsSlot->numSeqVar; j++)
01175         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", dsSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[j]);
01176       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
01177     }
01178     fprintf(stderr, "     seqVarIDs = ");
01179     if (!dsSlot->seqVarIDs) 
01180       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
01181     else {
01182       fprintf(stderr, "{\n");
01183       for (j = 0; j < dsSlot->numSeqVar; j++) {
01184      fprintf(stderr, "         seqVarIDs[%d] = { %d", j, 
01185                   dsSlot->seqVarIDs[j][0]);
01186      for (k = 1; k < dsSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[j]; k++)
01187        fprintf(stderr, ", %d", dsSlot->seqVarIDs[j][k]);
01188      fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
01189       }
01190       fprintf(stderr, "     }\n");
01191     }
01192     fflush(NULL);
01193   }
01194   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
01195   fflush(NULL);
01196   
01197   return;
01198 }
01199 
01200 /**
01201  * \ingroup  PrivateDataset
01202  * \brief  Free all entries in the dataset table
01203  *
01204  * \description
01205  *
01206  *    This should only be called after making sure that
01207  *    all slots have been cleared.
01208  *
01209  * \modifications  
01210  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
01211  */
01212 void _fc_freeDsTable() {
01213   int i;
01214   for (i = 0; i < dsTableSize; i++) {
01215     _fc_clearDsSlot(dsTable[i]);
01216     free(dsTable[i]);
01217   }
01218   free(dsTable);
01219   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&dsOpenSlots);
01220   dsTableSize = 0;
01221   dsTable = NULL;
01222 }
Generated on Wed Oct 31 11:09:58 2007 for FCLib by  1.5.1
